medical_history.chief_complaint: Enduring headaches that began abruptly 20 days prior.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The headaches started suddenly 20 days ago, characterized by continuous swelling pain predominantly in the left frontal-temporal area, and have not subsided with rest. Conservative treatment at a local hospital failed to alleviate the headache.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of epileptic episodes starting over ten years ago, characterized by periods of staring blankly with loss of consciousness, resolving spontaneously after approximately 3-5 minutes. Initially occurred every two days, reduced to about once per month with Carbamazepine treatment. Medication doses adjusted to Sodium Valproate and Topiramate but did not fully control seizure frequency. Imaging studies at two months indicated underdevelopment of the right cerebral hemisphere.
